author: Simon Difford
description: Fruity and lightly sweetened brandy cooled and diluted with crushed ice. What's not to like?The Brandy Old-Fashioned is often made using Californian brandy and depending on the sweetness of your brandy you may want to reduce the sugar syrup in this recipe. Use a wedge, rather than a slice, of orange as when muddled a slice breaks up too much leaving unsightly debris in the drink.
name: Brandy Old Fashioned (Wisconsin-style)
recipeIngredient: 5 ml Demerara/Muscovado/brown sugar syrup (2 sugar:1 water)

recipeInstructions.text: MUDDLE first 4 ingredients in base of glass
Add brandy and 6oz scoop crushed ice
